results.name: Triangle read by rows, T(n,k) = (n+1)*C(n-1,k-1).
comment: T(2n,n) gives A033876(n-1) for n>0. - _Alois P. Heinz_, Sep 04 2014
link: G. C. Greubel, Rows n=0..100 of triangle, flattened
example: First few rows of the triangle are:
mathematica: Table[(n+1)*Binomial[n-1, k-1], {n, 0, 10}, {k, 0, n}] // Flatten (* _G. C. Greubel_, May 05 2018 *)
program: (PARI) for(n=0,10, for(k=0,n, print1(if(n==0, 1,(n+1)*binomial(n-1,k-1)), ", "))) \\ _G. C. Greubel_, May 05 2018
(MAGMA) [[n le 0 select 1 else (n+1)*Binomial(n-1,k-1): k in [0..n]]: n in [0..10]]; // _G. C. Greubel_, May 05 2018
